title: Git-sim: Visually simulate Git operations in your own repos
dot:
digraph GitSim{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box];Introduction[label="Introduction
Confusing tool for new devs due to:
1. Complex concepts
2. Situational awareness
3. Many commands"];GitSim[label="What is Git-Sim?
Command-line tool in Python
Generates images/videos of Git command impacts"];Goals[label="Git-Sim Goals
1. Command-line interface
2. Familiar syntax
3. Fast output"];Features[label="Git-Sim Features
- Visualize Git commands
- Supported commands: log, status, add, etc.
- Animate output
- Light/dark mode"];Installation[label="How to Install
1. Install Manim
2. Install Git-Sim via pip"];Usage[label="How to Run Git-Sim
Run command: git-sim [options] <subcommand> [options]"];WorkFlow[label="How Does Git-Sim Work?
Uses Manim and GitPython
Only reads from the repo"];Contributing[label="Contributing to Git-Sim
Open to contributions and feedback"];Summary[label="Summary
Visualizes Git command impacts for all experience levels"];NextSteps[label="Next Steps
Install Git-Sim and start visualizing!"];Introduction->GitSim;GitSim->Goals;GitSim->Features;GitSim->Installation;Installation->Usage;GitSim->WorkFlow;GitSim->Contributing;GitSim->Summary;Summary->NextSteps;}
